subject.normal: [xsl] Position of a result tree fragment

headers.subject: RE: [xsl] Position of a result tree fragment

body.para: Larry, Add it's original position to the rtf when you make it.

quote.quotepara: -----Original Message----- From: owner-xsl-list@xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx [mailto:owner-xsl-list@xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx]On Behalf Of Laurence O Garfield Sent: 19 July 2001 00:08 To: xsl-list@xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx Subject: [xsl] Position of a result tree fragment

If I am passing a result tree fragment from one template to another using a variable, is there any way to determine what the fragment's position within its parent was originally? According to the XSLT spec I can't use /, //, or [] on result tree fragments, so I can't use [position()]. Is there some other way, or do I have to pass the position of the node through as a second variable as well?
-- "If at first you don't succeed, skydiving isn't for you." :-)
